programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang meets Salesforce Co-Founder and CEO Marc Benioff to discuss the rise of AI agents and what it's like to run a global tech company.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Bloomberg's Emily Chang interviews Mark Zuckerberg, Co-Founder, Chairman, and CEO of Meta Platforms, the company behind Facebook.

programme.title: Bullish With Sonali Basak
programme.desc: Building wealth used to follow a formula, but these days it's easier than ever to play the markets. With investing tools at everyone's fingertips, is it a chance for generational wealth or a siren call for suckers?

programme.title: Bullish With Sonali Basak
programme.desc: There's been a migration of financial powerbrokers to South Florida in recent years, drawn by various factors. It's hard to imagine the capital of finance leaving New York, but Wall Street South is getting bigger every day.

programme.title: Bullish With Sonali Basak
programme.desc: Wall Street pros often play poker, chess, blackjack and other games that rely on skills that are highly transferable to their work; the lines between finance and gaming are blurring faster than ever.

programme.title: The Future with Hannah Fry
programme.desc: Human survival depends on water, yet global reserves are rapidly shrinking; it's now replaced oil as the most likely cause of global conflict; discussing whether technology can help secure humanity's future water needs.

programme.title: The Future with Hannah Fry
programme.desc: Pain is a fact of life; for some, it is excruciating and inescapable; but amid the continuing fallout of the opioid crisis, the development of new technologies aims to limit and even eliminate pain.

programme.title: The Future with Hannah Fry
programme.desc: Soon, another billion people will be online, mostly from developing nations; ways new users will embrace this technology to transform their lives; its meaning for the rest of the world.

programme.title: Next in Sports
programme.desc: Pickleball is the hottest sport in America, with courts and converts across the U.S.; now backed by A-list investors, Pickle's going pro; testing the case for the paddle craze.

programme.title: Next in Sports
programme.desc: Not so long ago, it was the circuits of Monaco and Monza that epitomized Formula 1; its modern ambitions, however, came from Miami.

programme.title: Next in Sports
programme.desc: Despite Teqball being relatively unknown, its creators have big plans for the new sport.

programme.title: Next in Sports
programme.desc: For decades, cornhole was only played at tailgate parties and backyard barbecues; not anymore; The American Cornhole League has plans with big investors, millions of players and the helping hand of ESPN to change that.

programme.title: Next in Sports
programme.desc: Women's sports are breaking records, with interest in college and professional play at a high; Athletes Unlimited, a network of professional women's sports leagues, is capitalizing on the audience for women's softball, volleyball and basketball.

programme.title: The Deal With Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly
programme.desc: Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly sit with tennis champions Billie Jean King and Ilana Kloss to discuss the buzz around women's sports and hear how they helped grow professional women's hockey.

programme.title: The Deal: David Rubenstein
programme.desc: Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly talk with David Rubenstein, co-founder of The Carlyle Group, about his recent purchase of the Baltimore Orioles and what the team means for the city.

programme.title: The Deal With Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly
programme.desc: Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly talk with former NBA player Jay Williams about how he pivoted after a career-ending accident; starting Improbable Media; Jay's thoughts on NIL deals.

programme.title: Here's the Deal with Kellyanne
programme.desc: Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly talk with Nasdaq CEO Adena Friedman about her competitive deal-making mindset, how she transformed Nasdaq and the current sports business landscape.

programme.title: Here's the Deal with Kellyanne
programme.desc: Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly talk with Bruin Capital founder and CEO George Pyne about how he got started in sports, his role as an operator and his philosophy on sports investment.

programme.title: The Deal With Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly
programme.desc: Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly talk with former WNBA player, Candace Parker, about the explosion of women's basketball, why she teamed up with Adidas and her partnership with Marc Lasry.

programme.title: Bloomberg Primer
programme.desc: Scientists are developing more powerful magnets to enable clean energy sources like fusion; China's dominance of the supply chain for rare earth magnets threatens their global availability.

programme.title: Bloomberg Primer
programme.desc: Exploring the world of biocomputing; scientists are laying the foundation for a field that may blur the lines between the biological and synthetic.

programme.title: Bloomberg Primer
programme.desc: Geothermal has been the underdog of the energy industry, but that may be about to change as new startups use fracking technologies to expand potential geothermal sites.

programme.title: Bloomberg Primer
programme.desc: Scientists and entrepreneurs are testing radical ideas like solar radiation management and ocean fertilization; they are finding funding for them.

programme.title: Bloomberg Primer
programme.desc: The idea of flying cars has largely remained science fiction, until now; a new generation of electrified aircraft is attracting the attention of investors and venture capitalists around the world.

programme.title: Bloomberg Primer
programme.desc: Governments and entrepreneurs are racing to commercialize the moon; these efforts could unlock a new, deep-space economy; but to return and stay will require the highest levels of innovation.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: A Bloomberg Originals series hosted by Emily Chang that goes behind the scenes with founders, influencers and innovators.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang explores Stargate, a $500 billion AI project; she interviews OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and Softbank CEO Masayoshi Son about their vision for the initiative.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang goes inside Stargate, an historic $500 billion bet on the future of AI; she speaks with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and Softbank CEO Masayoshi Son about their hopes for the project.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang speaks with Microsoft titans Bill Gates, Steve Ballmer and Satya Nadella about the company's journey from scrappy startup to global powerhouse.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang speaks with Microsoft titans Bill Gates, Steve Ballmer and Satya Nadella about the company's journey from scrappy startup to global powerhouse.

programme.title: Posthuman
programme.desc: Emily Chang meets some of the world's most advanced, and most intelligent robots and questions whether the creation of a synthetic species with human-like intelligence improves the human experience or ends it.

programme.title: Posthuman
programme.desc: Emily Chang explores the future of connections with the machines and the technologies powering a growing market of relationships-on-demand.

programme.title: Posthuman
programme.desc: From brain implants that allow paralyzed patients to communicate to the wearable devices enhancing human capabilities, brain-computer interfaces could change the way people use their minds forever.

programme.title: Posthuman
programme.desc: From birth to death, tech is stretching the boundaries of biology; exploring the discoveries that could transform reproduction, healthcare and how people die.

programme.title: Roblox's Predator Problem
programme.desc: Tens of millions of kids play Roblox daily, but is the internet's playground safe? Bloomberg investigates cases of predators who have used the platform to groom and sometimes meet kids in real life.

programme.title: Sex-for-Work Claims in West Africa's Rubber Industry
programme.sub-title: Sex-for-Work Claims in West Africa's Rubber Industry
programme.desc: A company majority-owned by billionaire Vincent Bolloré's Bolloré Group and Hubert Fabri is the subject of allegations of labor abuses at some of its African rubber plantations, including by female workers who say they were forced to engage in sex.

programme.title: The Growing Toll of America's Booming Kratom Industry
programme.sub-title: The Growing Toll of America's Booming Kratom Industry
programme.desc: American use of the plant Kratom has grown dramatically, spurring both a lucrative industry while worrying health experts; discussing how the unregulated substance is being promoted and even made more potent and how some users are ending up dead.

programme.desc: Wall Street pros often play poker, chess, blackjack and other games that rely on skills that are highly transferable to their work; the lines between finance and gaming are blurring faster than ever.

programme.desc: Building wealth used to follow a formula, but these days it's easier than ever to play the markets. With investing tools at everyone's fingertips, is it a chance for generational wealth or a siren call for suckers?

programme.title: Bullish With Sonali Basak
programme.desc: There's been a migration of financial powerbrokers to South Florida in recent years, drawn by the weather, light regulation and low taxes; it's hard to imagine the capital of finance leaving New York, but Wall Street South is getting bigger.

programme.title: Bloomberg Investigates
programme.desc: The demand for human eggs is booming, giving rise to a largely unregulated and dangerous marketplace; in India, meeting a teenage girl caught up in this fertility underworld.

programme.title: Bloomberg Investigates: How a Ugandan Clinic Exposed a Private Healthcare Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Bloomberg Investigates: How a Ugandan Clinic Exposed a Private Healthcare Tragedy
programme.desc: In a Kampala slum, a group of midwives help vulnerable mothers give birth for free. Under a mile away, a private hospital is out of reach for most of the community, with devastating consequences.
